sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 1, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Griesinger Georg August Griesinger, Biographische Notizen über Joseph Haydn (Leipzig: Breitkopf & Härtel, 1810). zuende exzerpiert.
Von 11–12h Eröffnungsfeier Händel u. Haydn.
Nach Sieverung: besichtigen einer schönen Wohnung, uns leider nicht erreichbar; Versuch zu Frau Rothberger zu gelangen mißlingt – im Auto heimgefahren.

Abends: Kolisch spielt Beethoven op. 131, sehr schön! According to the radio listings in the Neue freie Presse, the broadcast of Op. 131 by the Kolisch Quartet took place the following day, October 2.
Excerpts from Griesinger completed.
From 11 to 12 o’clock, opening ceremony of the Handel and Haydn celebrations.
To Sievering: we look at an attractive apartment, which is unfortunately beyond our means; an attempt to get to Mrs. Rothberger’s goes awry – home by automobile.
In the evening: Kolisch plays Beethoven’s Op. 131, very beautifully!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 2, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Baumgarten (Kartenbr.): Dank.
Vergeblicher Weg zur Aspangpost, 10–¾11h.
Griesinger Georg August Griesinger, Biographische Notizen über Joseph Haydn (Leipzig: Breitkopf & Härtel, 1810). durch Wolf an KromerPhA/Ar 56, [11] zurückgeschickt.
Von Frl. Violin (K.): Absage.

Von Baumgarten (Br., Aufsätze Oswald Jonas, Heinrich Schenker, Allgemeine Musikzeitung, 60th year, No. 36, September 8, 1933, pp. 425–7 (first part of the article), and No. 37, September 15, 1933, pp. 437–9 (conclusion of the article). See diary entry of September 29, 1933. rec.!): habe etwas begriffen u. glaube, daß Wien sich bekehren würde, wenn nur ich . . !
Brünauer: „… sobald ich werde können, werde ich Honorar leisten.“
Abends fällt Regen ein.
From Baumgarten (lettercard): thanks.
Abortive trip to the Aspang post office, 10 o’clock to 10:45.
Griesinger sent back to Kromer via WolfPhA/Ar 56, [11].
From Miss Violin (postcard): cancellation.
From Baumgarten (letter, articles by registered mail!): he has understood something, and believes that Vienna would be won over if only I …!
Brünauer: "… as soon as I am able, I shall give you the lesson fee."
In the evening, rain arrives.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 3, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Deutsch (Br.OJ 10/3, [198]): die Frau hat an v. Hoboken geschrieben, erhöht auf S. 300, Senkung der Bezüge überall – Aufstellung der Bibliothek noch unverbindlich This refers to the Hoboken’s plan to move his collection of first and early music prints to the Austrian National Library. – Haas noch nichts sagen. Na, die Zeche werde vermutlich, wie immer, ich bezahlen. Offenbar war die Not bei Deutsch auf das Aeußerste gestiegen, sonst hätte er einsehen müssen, daß von allen Wegen der des Bettlers bei v. H. der bedenklichste ist u. ihn erst recht kopfscheu macht; auch hätte er den Schaden bedenken müssen, den er mit dem Schritt Anderen zufügt. Ich glaube nicht, daß v. H. herzlich gern eine „Rente“ von S. 300 monatlich für nichts bezahlt! An sich ist D.s Forderung eine Anmaßung u. Selbstüberschätzung, die erklärt, weshalb er mich hinter Mandyzewsky e tutti quanti stellt, er weiß es nicht besser.

Familie Violin von 5–9h; Lie-Liechen, wie immer, aus unserem 3000 S.-„Monatsbrauch“ – wir freuten uns, ihnen eine Eßfreude bereiten zu können, auf die sie heute erpichter
sind denn je, die Armen!
Der deutsche Wahnsinn schreitet einem Gipfel zu: ein Attentat auf Dollfuß!!!

From Deutsch (letterOJ 10/3, [198]): his wife has written to Hoboken, requesting her husband’s monthly stipend to be raised to 300 shillings; decline in stipends everywhere – the establishment of his library is still not fixed – he is saying nothing yet to Haas. Well, I shall probably end up paying the bill, as usual. Evidently, Deutsch’s hardship had reached its limit, otherwise he would have surely realized that, of all the paths leading to Hoboken, that of the beggar is the most risky and the one most likely to make him resistant; he would also have had to consider the damage his move would have inflicted on others. I do not believe that Hoboken would sincerely have been glad to pay a monthly "pension" of 300 shillings in return for nothing! Considered in itself, Deutsch’s demand is a form of arrogance and an exaggerated opinion of himself, which explains why he places me lower than Mandyzewsky and all the rest; he knows no better.

The Violin family from 5 to 9 o’clock; Lie-Liechen, as always, drawing from our "monthly ration" of 3,000 shillings – we were delighted to have been able to provide a culinary pleasure, on which they are keener today
than ever, poor folk!
German madness has approached a summit: an attempted assassination of Dollfuß!!!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 4, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Willfort (K.): auf Wiedersehen Freitag.
Von Salzer (Br.): kann erst nächsten Freitag kommen.
Nach der Jause in der Stadt: Postweg: Saphir, Feuerversicherung, DAZ.
To Willfort (postcard): I shall see him again on Friday.
From Salzer (letter): he cannot come until next Friday.
After teatime, in the city; trip to the post office to make payments: Saphir, fire insurance, DAZ.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 5, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Floriz (K.): ist von Weisberger eingeladen worden, wird berichten.

An Jonas (K.OJ 5/18, 28 ): soll der Aufsatz Oswald Jonas, Heinrich Schenker, Allgemeine Musikzeitung, 60th year, No. 36, September 8, 1933, pp. 425–7 (first part of the article), and No. 37, September 15, 1933, pp. 437–9 (conclusion of the article). (See the diary entry of October 7, 1933) nach München gehen?
Ich bleibe zuhause.
From Floriz (postcard): he has had an invitation from Weisberger, will report.
To Jonas (postcardOJ 5/18, 28 ): should the article go to Munich?
I stay at home.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 6, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Hoboken (Br.): Ausschnitte u. Ankündigung des Honorars; Ankunft noch im Oktober; gibt seine Haager Adresse an.
An Deutsch Karte darüber.
Bestelle Karten zu den Toscanini-Konzerten durch Frl. Kraus.
Nach der Jause in die Stadt zur Auszahlungsstelle des Drei Masken Verlags (Dr. Hain): das Geld ist schon unterwegs.
Abends: lese den § „Figurirung“ von Der freie Satz vor.
From Hoboken (letter): clippings, and announcement of the lesson fee; he will still arrive in October; gives me his address in The Hague.
To Deutsch, a postcard about this.
We order tickets to the Toscanini concerts through Miss Kraus.
After teatime, to the city, to the cashier’s desk at Drei Masken Verlag (Dr. Hain): the money is already on its way.
Evening: I read aloud the paragraph "Figuration" from Free Composition.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 7, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Das Geld vom Drei Masken Verlag: S. 47 (über Mönichkirchen!).
Von Hoboken durch die Rotterdamer Bank S. 1560.
An die Bank Bestätigung.

An v. H. (Br.OJ 89/9, [2]): Ausschnitte u. Dank; (die Sendung geht nach München); der Züricher Brief verloren gegangen?! Bemerkungen zu den Ausschnitten; als Drucksache die Jonas-Hefte. The issues of the Allgemeine Musikzeitung containing Jonas’s two-part Heinrich Schenker (for details, see diary entry for October 2, 1933, note 2).

An Jonas (K.OJ 5/18, 29 ): die Hefte The issues of the Allgemeine Musikzeitung containing Jonas’s two-part Heinrich Schenker (for details, see diary entry for October 2, 1933, note 2). sind abgeschickt.
Nach der Jause Wege.

Rf. „Prinz Methusalem“ in originaler Fassung According to the radio listings of the Neue freie Presse, Johann Strauss’s operetta Prinz Methusalem was broadcast in Karl Treumann’s German translation. It was performed by the chorus of the Volksoper and the Vienna Radio Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Josef Holzer. – dazu eine Partie Patiençe in zwei Legen.
Lie-Liechen schreibt bis ½1h.
The money from Drei Masken Verlag: 47 shillings (by way of Mönichkirchen!).
From Hoboken, via the Rotterdam Bank, 1,560 shillings.
To the bank: confirmation of receipt.
To Hoboken (letterOJ 89/9, [2]): clippings, and thanks (the package is sent to Munich); has the Zurich letter gone missing?! Remarks on the clippings; as printed papers, the Jonas issues.
To Jonas (postcardOJ 5/18, 29 ): the issues have been sent off.
After teatime, errands.
Radio: Prince Methuselah in the original setting – in addition, a game of solitaire completed in two rounds.
Lie-Liechen writes until 12:30.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 8, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Floriz (K.OJ 8/5, [21]): das Ergebnis?
Die Jause im Aspang Garten!
Diktire ein paar Sätze zum Haydn-Aufsatz. An article intended for the Deutsche Zeitschrift but never completed; File 49 in the Oster Collection contains extensive materials for it.
Lese den Schluss des Paragraphen „Figurirung“ in Der freie Satz vor.
To Floriz (postcardOJ 8/5, [21]): the result?
Afternoon snack in the Aspang garden!
I dictate a few lines for the Haydn article.
Read aloud the end of the paragraph on "Figuration" in Free Composition.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 9, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: – arbeite im Erker.
Paula wird ausbezahlt.
„Diminution“ in Der freie Satz – Fortsetzung – lese vormittags vor.

Von Salzer (K. expreß): möchte mich
möchte mich vor Freitag sprechen.
An Reitzer (Br. Lie-Liechen): Absage.
Lie-Liechen schreibt bis spät nachts.
– I work in the alcove.
Paula is paid out.
"Diminution" in Free Composition – continuation – I read through it in the morning.

From Salzer (express postcard): he would like to speak with me
before Friday.
To Reitzer (letter from Lie-Liechen): cancellation.
Lie-Liechen writes until late at night.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 10, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Salzer (K. expressFS 40/1, [18]): Donnerstag um 11h.

Violin von 11–¾12h – bringt Zuckerkandl zurück Most likely Viktor Zuckerkandl’s Musikalische Gestaltung der grossen Opernpartien: jugendlich-dramatisches Fach (Berlin: Max Hesse, 1932). This book is known to have been in Schenker's personal library at the time of his death: see Musik und Theater enthaltend die Bibliothek des Herrn † Dr. Heinrich Schenker, Wien (Vienna: Antiquariat Heinrich Hinterberger, n.d.), item 319. – über den Weisberger-Schwindel.
Nach der Jause besichtigen wir auf der Türkenschanze eine Wohnung.
To Salzer (express postcardFS 40/1, [18]): Thursday at 11 o’clock.
Violin from 11 o’clock to 11:45 – he returns Zuckerkandl – concerning the Weisberger fraud.
After teatime, we look at an apartment on the Türkenschanze.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 11, 1933

tei:ab.tei:seg: Frau Mitzi Jansky scheuert das Musikzimmer u. das Vorzimmer – S. 12.
Mrs. Mitzi Jansky scrubs the music room and the foyer – 12 shillings.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 12, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von 11–12h: Dr. Salzer kommt mich begrüßen.
Den ganzen Tag zuhause.
From 11 to 12 o’clock: Dr. Salzer comes to say hello to me.
The entire day at home.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 13, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lehne Karten zum Toscanini-Konzert zu S. 20 ab; will die Snob-Luft nicht athmen! Die Philharmoniker lassen sich die Proben bezahlen, die sie nötig haben – was müßten sie mir zahlen, wenn ich mit ihnen u. Toscanini Probe abhielte! Ich muß meine Leistung unentgeltlich abgeben, obendrein zu Niemandes Nutzen.
Nach der Jause bei der Miederin u. Einkauf.

I turn down tickets for the Toscanini concert costing 20 shillings; I do not want to breathe the snobbish air! The Philharmonic can pay for the rehearsals that they require – what would they have to pay me if I were to hold a rehearsal with them and Toscanini! I must give away my accomplishments without pay, moreover to no one’s benefit.
After teatime, at the corset-maker’s, and shopping.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 14, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Scharfer Ritt durch Beispiele der Fig. 119 – ich setze eine Pause!
Nach der Jause Wege.
Extraausgabe!! – : Deutschland tritt aus dem Völkerbund!
A hard ride through the examples in Fig. 119 – I take a break!
After teatime, errands.
Special Edition!!: Germany is leaving the League of Nations!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 15, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: – Jause bei Sacher – Spaziergang.
– afternoon snack at the Sacher – a walk.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 16, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Erste Heitzung – Winteranzug!
Von Arnold u. Rosl (Ansichtsk.): Grüße aus Meran!
Ein Exemplar einer Wochenschrift von Dr. Fritz Klein!
Von Frau Tity Weiss-Hausleithner> (Br.OJ 15/13, [1]): ersucht um die Adresse der Baronesse Fischer u. der Wäscherin.

Nach Tisch zur Mercurbank: S. 2000 ins Buch u. S. 1000 Trefferanleihe. Trefferanleihe: a bond offered for subscription by the Austrian Federal Government in October 1933 at a rate of interest of 4%; it provided additional opportunities to make a profit by taking part in a lottery and a cover against loss in value. (AEIOU-Österreich Lexikon online.)
First heating of the apartment – winter suit!
From Arnold and Rosl (picture postcard): greetings from Merano!
A copy of a weekly paper from Dr. Fritz Klein!
From Mrs. Tity Weiss-Hausleithner> (letterOJ 15/13, [1]): asks for the addresses of Baroness Fischer and the laundress.
After lunch, to the Mercurbank: 2,000 shillings paid into the book, and a 1,000-shilling lottery bond purchased.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 17, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Frau Dr. Bienenfeld ein Separatdruck: „Ertaubte Musiker“. Elsa Bienenfeld, Ertaubte Tondichter (Vienna: Perles, 1933), an offprint from the Wiener Medizinische Wochenschrift, no. 39 (1933).
Nach der Jause kauft Lie-Liechen in der Wollzeile Linoleum.
From Mrs. Dr. Bienenfeld, an offprint: Deaf Musicians.
After teatime, Lie-Liechen buys linoleum in the Wollzeile.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 18, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von der Mercurbank (Br.): Bestätigung des Kaufes.
Um ¼4h bei Dr. Neumann: zieht mir zwei Zähne!!
From the Mercurbank (letter): confirmation of the purchase.
At 3:15, at Dr. Neumann’s: he pulls two of my teeth!!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 19, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: „Haydn“. An article intended for the Deutsche Zeitschrift but never completed; File 49 in the Oster Collection contains extensive materials for it.

Von der Mercurbank (Br. rec.): über den Kauf der Anleihe. See diary entry for October 16. Schenker had purchased a bond offered for subscription by the Austrian Federal Government in October 1933 at a rate of interest of 4%, which offered additional opportunities to make a profit by taking part in a lottery and a cover against loss in value.
Von Halberstam (Br.): gibt Daten an.
Lie-Liechen hat schon ein Kilo an Gewicht verloren.
An die Krankenkasse (Br.): Lie-Liechen schickt den Zahlungsauftrag zurück: ein Vierteljahr war überhaupt kein Mädchen im Hause!
Work on "Haydn."
From the Mercurbank (registered letter): concerning the purchase of the bond.
From Halberstam (letter): he suggests dates.
Lie-Liechen has already lost a kilogram in weight.
To the health insurance company (letter): Lie-Liechen returns the payment slip: there was no maid at all in our home for a quarter of a year!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 20, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Zwischen 6–¼8h bei Halberstam: „sehr gut“ (trotz Rachenkatarrh) – Dank an Gott u. Lie-Liechen!
Between 6 o’clock and 7:15, at Halberstam’s: "very good" (in spite of the catarrh in my throat) – thanks be to God and Lie-Liechen!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 21, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Plötzliche Verschlimmerung im Kehlkopf u. in den Augen!
Um 3h bei Fuchs: warnt mich dringendst, das linke Auge sei sehr übermüdet, entzündet! Vor Fuchs’ Haus stoßen wir auf Halberstam, er gibt Ratschläge gegen den Kehlkopfkatarrh.
Um 6h Frühmann – das Nötige wird aus der Apotheke geholt u. Lie-Liechen beginnt mit der Behandlung.
Sudden worsening in my larynx and in my eyes!

At 3 o’clock, at Dr. Fuchs’s: he warns me most urgently that the left eye is overtired and inflamed! In front of Fuchs’s house, we bump into Halberstam; he gives advice about dealing with the catarrh in my larynx.
At 6 o’clock, Frühmann – the necessary items are collected from the drugstore, and Lie-Liechen makes a start on the treatment.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 22, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Eine wundervolle Nacht, dann ein Rückfall infolge Aufregung. Kein Zweifel, daß Aufregung den Blutandrang zu Kehle u. Auge verursacht.
Hausarrest!
A wonderful night, followed by a setback as a result of excitement. Without doubt, excitement was the cause of the congestion of my larynx and eyes.
House arrest!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 23, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Arbeit ist für das Auge anstrengend, der Unterricht für den Rachen!
Von Mittler Einladung zum Kompositionsabend.
Work is strenuous for the eye, teaching for the throat!
From Mittler, invitation to the composition evening.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 24, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Sophie (Br.): häuslicher Bericht u. zwei Kinderbilder.
Abbestellung an die Südmark u. Zahlung S. 1.20.
Nach der Jause Diktat.
Hausarrest.
From Sophie (letter): domestic report and two pictures of the children.
Cancellation of my subscription to the Südmark, and a payment of 1.20 shillings.
After teatime, dictation.
House arrest.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 25, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Ein Zoll Arbeit.
Um ¾3h: zum Beispiel der neuen Figur für Der freie Satz aus dem Bett.

Von 5–½8h Deutsch: schwierige Lage im Hause – v. H.s Antwort cynisch u. der Wahrheit widersprechend – erinnert an seine Briefe u. Brief-Bübereien contra Vrieslander. D. ist zu eigensinnig um zu verstehen, wie sehr er sich in einen bequemen Egoismus verrannt hat. Ausgerechnet aus H. wollte er ein Ideal von einem Mäzen herausschlagen, den Bibliophilen
auf Leben u. Tod!
An inch of work.
At 2:45, out of bed to work on the example for the new figure for Free Composition.

From 5 o’clock to 7:30, Deutsch: a difficult situation at home – Hoboken’s reply is cynical, and contradicts the truth – it reminds me of his letters and his epistolary knavery against Vrieslander. Deutsch is too obstinate to understand how much he has become obsessed by a convenient self-interest. He wanted to make a benefactor of Hoboken of all people, a bibliophile
in life and death!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 26, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von der DAZ (Br.): Verbot für drei Monate. In the 247th edition of the DAZ, Fritz Klein’s article Fraternal Strife ("Bruderzwist"), on Hitler’s relationship to the Austrian Chancellor Engelbert Dollfuss, led to the temporary ban on the publication of the newspaper, and the sacking of Klein as editor-in-chief. After his dismissal, Klein helped found a new paper, Deutsche Zukunft, of which he became the first editor.
An Floriz (K.OJ 8/5, [22]): über Wolf.
An Oppel (K.): wie das Befinden?
Floriz von 4–5h: kann sich noch zwei Monate halten!
Lie-Liechen wurde von Dr. Mestitz gesund befunden – Gott halte sie weiter in Gnade!
Nach dem Abendessen einen Paragraphen diktiert.
From the DAZ (letter): publishing ban for three months.
To Floriz (postcardOJ 8/5, [22]): concerning Wolf.
To Oppel (postcard): how is he?
Floriz from 4 to 5 o’clock: he can make ends meet for another two months!
Lie-Liechen is found to be in good health by Dr. Mestitz – may God continue to bless her!
After supper, a paragraph dictated.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 27, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: 2015-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Ein Fläschchen zur Analyse.
An Floriz (K.OJ 8/5, [23]): bitte um volle Freiheit im Verkehr, Mittwoch wird für Feste vorgemerkt.
Bei Prof. Fuchs: gut, aber nicht viel arbeiten u. Ruhe wahren!
Befund: 0.

Rf.: „Indigo“ im Original! Dieser göttlichen Musik wegen muß der Text hingenommen werden wie in der „Zauberflöte“, in „Trovatore“, Euryanthe u. ä. Slezak originell u. gütig als Conférencier. Eine Sensation Alles in Allem, auch Lily Klaus. According to the listings in the Neue freie Presse, Lilly Claus sang the role of Fantaska in this performance, which was part of a radio series of Johann Strauss’s operas (see diary entry for October 7, 1933). The chorus of the Volksoper and the Vienna Radio Symphony Orchestra were conducted by Josef Holzer.
A sample for analysis.
To Floriz (postcardOJ 8/5, [23]): I ask him to be completely free in his association with me; Wednesdays shall be reserved for celebrations.
At Prof. Fuchs’s: things are good, but I should not work too hard, and should keep calm!
Result: 0.

On the radio: Indigo and the Forty Thieves in its original setting! For the sake of this divine music, the text has to be tolerated, as is the case in The Magic Flute, in Il trovatore, Euryanthe, and the like. Slezak original and endearing as the Master of Ceremonies. A sensation in every respect, including Lily Klaus.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 28, 1933

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Baronin Fischer (Br.): die Dame hat sich nicht gemeldet!!

An Dr. Bienenfeld (K.): Dank für den Sonderdruck „Ertaubte Musiker“. Elsa Bienenfeld, Ertaubte Tondichter (Vienna: Perles, 1933), an offprint from the Wiener Medizinische Wochenschrift, no. 39 (1933).
An Halberstam (Br.): den schönen Befund.
In der Stadt: Naschwerk von Fritz.
Jetty wartet beim Fleischer auf uns.
From Baroness Fischer (letter): the lady did not get in touch!!
To Dr. Bienenfeld (postcard): thanks for the offprint of Deaf Musicians.
To Halberstam (letter): the happy result of the urinalysis.
In the city: sweets from Fritz.
Jetty waits for us at the butcher’s.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 29, 1933

sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von ¼12–½1h Floriz u. Tochter – hören mit mir Toscanini: Anakreontische-Ouvertüre u. Brahms III. Sinfonie – elend – hoch Furtwängler!!

¼6–¼7h Bei Sacher die blaue Stunde Blue hour: a period of twilight each morning and evening when the sun is a significant distance below the horizon and the residual, indirect sunlight takes on a predominantly blue hue. – der starke Wind jagt uns heim.
Diktat.
From 11:15 to 12:30, Floriz and his daughter – they listen to Toscanini with me on the radio: Overture to Cherubini’s Anacreon and Brahms’s Third Symphony – wretched – three cheers for Furtwängler!!
5:15 to 6:15 at the Sacher, the blue hour – the strong wind forces us home.
Dictation.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker October 30, 1933

sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Oppel (Br.): ein Händel Stück – über seinen Gesundheitszustand – unzufrieden mit Allem.

Von Dr. Fritz Klein die zweite Nummer seiner Wochenzeitung. After the Deutsche Allgemeine Zeitung was, on Hitler’s orders, banned for a time from publishing, and its editor-in-chief Fritz Klein dismissed, Klein helped to establish a new paper, Deutsche Zukunft, of which he became its first editor.
Brünauer will nicht sagen, daß er Toscanini gehört hat, verrät sich aber durch Fragen!
Zuhause geblieben.
From Oppel (letter): a piece by Handel – concerning his health – dissatisfaction with everything.
From Dr. Fritz Klein: the second issue of his weekly paper.
Brünauer does not want to admit that he heard Toscanini, but betrays himself through questions!
I remained at home.

tei:ab.tei:seg: Um ¾5 beim Zahnarzt.

An Weil (Br. Lie-Liechen): bittet um Victors Brief u. etwas zum Jonas Aufsatz. That is, a reaction to Oswald Jonas’s Heinrich Schenker, Allgemeine Musikzeitung, 60th year, No. 36, September 8, 1933, pp. 425–7 (first part of the article), and No. 37, September 15, 1933, pp. 437–9 (conclusion of the article).
At 4:45, at the dentist.
To Weil (letter from Lie-Liechen): she asks for Victor’s letter and something about Jonas’s article.
